**Niklaus J. Gr&uuml;nwald** is a plant pathologist with the USDA Agricultural
Research Service and a Professor in the Department of Botany and Pant Pathology
and the Center for Genome Research and Biocomputing at Oregon State University.
He received his PhD from UC Davis and conducted postdoctoral research at Cornell
University. His research focuses on understanding the evolutionary patterns and
processes of emerging pathogens using population genetic and evolutionary
approaches.

<small>
**Zhian N. Kamvar** is a graduate student in the Department of Botany and Pant
Pathology at Oregon State University. His research is focused on genome
sequencing and population genomics of the nursery pathogen *Phytophthora
syringae*. He is the lead developer of the [*poppr* R
package](http://github.com/grunwaldlab/poppr) and a contributor to the
[*adegenet* R package](http://github.com/thibautjombart/adegenet). Zhian is also
co-host of the award-winning radio program [Inspiration
Dissemination](http://poweredbyorange.com/2013/12/17/science-through-a-microphone/).
<p>

**Sydney E. Everhart** is an Assistant Professor at the University of Nebraska-
Lincoln. Her research utilizes population genetics and genomics to better
understand disease dynamics and evolution of fungal plant pathogens.  She
developed the micrsoatellite markers and data used in the
[`monpop`](Data_sets.html#microsatellite-haploid-clonal-monpop) data set and
currently works with genomes, GBS data, and SSR data for *Phytophthora ramorum*.
